title: How to Block Senders in Gmail

steps.title: Open Gmail.
steps.content: Open Gmail. Type gmail.com into your browser and sign into your account, if you aren’t already. Navigate to your Gmail home page and click on “Inbox” to view all of your messages. [1] X Research source If your password is saved on your computer, you probably won’t have to sign in again.

steps.title: Open the email from the sender you’d like to block.
steps.content: Open the email from the sender you’d like to block. Find the message from the sender that you’d no longer like to get emails from. Click on their message to open it up. [2] X Research source If you deleted the message, check your trash folder instead of your inbox. If you sent it to spam, look in your spam folder.

steps.title: Press “More” in the top right corner of the message.
steps.content: Press “More” in the top right corner of the message. Navigate to the top corner of the message where it says “More” with the 3 dots next to it. Click on the button to open the dropdown menu for your options. [3] X Research source On some displays, the button will just look like the 3 dots, and it won’t say “More.” You can also use this dropdown menu to report phishing or spam.

steps.title: Click “Block (sender).”
steps.content: Click “Block (sender).” The block option will be the fourth option down from the dropdown menu. Click on the “Block (sender)” option to automatically remove their email from your inbox and block any future messages. [4] X Research source This block option will automatically send any emails from the sender to your spam folder. It will not bounce the emails back, and the sender won’t be able to see that you’ve blocked them.

steps.title: Open the Gmail app.
steps.content: Open the Gmail app. Click on your Gmail app and make sure that you’re signed in. Navigate to your inbox to see all of your messages. [5] X Research source If you don’t have the Gmail app, you can open up gmail.com on your web browser and follow the steps for blocking senders like you’re on a computer.

steps.title: Click on the message from the sender.
steps.content: Click on the message from the sender. Find the message from the person that you’d like to block and open it up. If you can’t find it, check your spam or trash folders. [6] X Research source If you’ve emptied the email from your trash folder, you won’t be able to block the sender until they send you another email.

steps.title: Tap “More” in the top right corner of the message.
steps.content: Tap “More” in the top right corner of the message. Look for the 3 dots in the top right corner of the message, then click on them. This will open up a dropdown menu with a few different options for the email. [7] X Research source On iPhones, the 3 dots will be vertical. On Androids, the 3 dots are horizontal. You can also use this dropdown menu to report phishing or spam.

steps.title: Tap “Block (sender).”
steps.content: Tap “Block (sender).” In the dropdown menu, click on the block sender option to automatically remove the email from your inbox. Now, any emails you receive from the sender will be automatically sent to your spam folder. [8] X Research source The sender won’t be able to see that you blocked them, and their emails won’t get bounced back to them.

steps.title: Install the Block Sender Chrome Extension.
steps.content: Install the Block Sender Chrome Extension. The Block Sender extension is made specifically for Google Chrome web browsers. Head to their website and click on “Install the Plugin” to start the installation process. [9] X Research source With the free version of Block Sender, you can link 1 email address and block senders, but you won’t be able to bounce emails back. With the Plus version of Block Sender, you can link 1 email address and block senders, and you can also bounce emails back. This version costs $5 per month. With the Pro version of Block Sender, you can link 3 email addresses and both block senders and bounce emails back, plus other perks. This version costs $9 per month. You can download Block Sender by visiting https://blocksender.io/ .

steps.title: Open your Gmail account.
steps.content: Open your Gmail account. Once Block Sender has downloaded and installed on your computer, head to your Gmail account and make sure that you’re signed in. If you don’t see a “Block” button at the top of your inbox options, refresh your page until you do. [10] X Research source If you still aren’t seeing the “Block” button, try signing out of your Gmail account and signing back in.

steps.title: Select the messages from the sender you’d like to block.
steps.content: Select the messages from the sender you’d like to block. In your inbox, click the checkmark box next to the message or messages from the sender. You can check one box at a time, or you can check multiple boxes from multiple senders to mass block them. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Click “Block Selected Emails” in the “Block” box.
steps.content: Click “Block Selected Emails” in the “Block” box. At the top of your inbox underneath the search bar, find the “Block” button and click on it to open the dropdown menu. Click on “Block Selected Emails” to automatically block all messages from the senders that you’ve selected. [12] X Research source With the free version of Block Sender, the emails will never reach your inbox or spam folder, and the sender won’t be able to see that you’ve blocked them. With both paid versions of Block Sender, you can choose to stop receiving emails and/or bounce the emails back with a fake “incorrect email address” message. This will not tell the sender that they are blocked, but it can trick them into thinking they have the wrong email address.
